org.openstreetmap.travelingsalesman.trafficblocks.tmc
Class GNCFilteringInputStream

java.lang.Object
  java.io.InputStream
      org.openstreetmap.travelingsalesman.trafficblocks.tmc.GNCFilteringInputStream
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Closeable
public final class GNCFilteringInputStream
extends java.io.InputStream

Input-stream that filters binary RDS and TMC -messages in GNC-encofing from an NMEA-stream.
GNC-encoding inserts a 10 byte block made up of a start-byte, 8 data-bytes and a stop-byte at any location into the NMEA-data.
This Filter removes these GNC-blocks and outputs the original NMEA -data.
Note that GNC is not the only encoding of TMC-data in NMEA-streams and some receivers require the client to send a byte-sequence to activate TMC-output.

Author:
Marcus Wolschon

Method Detail

createTMCFilter

public static java.io.BufferedReader createTMCFilter(java.io.InputStream aInputStream,
                                                     java.io.OutputStream aOutputStream,
                                                     GNCFilteringInputStream.TMCListener aListener)
Create a reader that filters out GNC-type and Royaltek-type RDS-TMC -messages and handles them. Only the remaining NMEA remains to be read from it.

Parameters:
aInputStream - The stream where the NMEA+RDS comes from.
aOutputStream - (may be null) stream to write commands for tuning and for activating rds-tmc to
aListener - a listener for the filtered out TMC-messaged
Returns:
a reader for the pure NMEA data with RDS-TMC already filtered out
